Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 (2011 PPP) (% of population)
indicator_description_long: % of population living in households with consumption or income per person below the $1.90 poverty line at 2011 international prices. As a result of revisions in PPP exchange rates, poverty rates for individual countries cannot be compared with poverty rates reported in earlier editions.

indicator_description_short: Poverty headcount ratio at $3.20 (2011 PPP) (% of population)
indicator_description_long: % of population living in households with consumption or income per person below the $3.20 poverty line at 2011 international prices. As a result of revisions in PPP exchange rates, poverty rates for individual countries cannot be compared with poverty rates reported in earlier editions.

As a result of revisions in PPP exchange rates, poverty rates for individual countries cannot be compared with poverty rates reported in earlier editions.

indicator_description_short: Survey mean/average consumption or income per capita, total population (2017 PPP $ per day)
indicator_description_long: The mean is the average monthly household per capita income or consumption expenditure from the survey in 2017 PPP.

indicator_description_short: Survey median consumption or income per capita, total population (2017 PPP $ per day)
indicator_description_long: The median of monthly household per capita income or consumption expenditure from the survey in 2017 PPP.

indicator_description_short: Gini index (World Bank estimate)
indicator_description_long: Gini index measures the extent to which the distribution of income (or, in some cases, consumption expenditure) among individuals or households within an economy deviates from a perfectly equal distribution. A Lorenz curve plots the cumulative percentages of total income received against the cumulative number of recipients, starting with the poorest individual or household. The Gini index measures the area between the Lorenz curve and a hypothetical line of absolute equality, expressed as a percentage of the maximum area under the line. Thus, a Gini index of 0 represents perfect equality, while an index of 100 implies perfect inequality.

indicator_description_short: Theil index (World Bank estimate)
indicator_description_long: The Theil index is part of a larger family of measures referred to as the General Entropy class. The Theil index measures an entropic "distance" the population is away from the "ideal" egalitarian state of everyone having the same income. The Theil index ranges between zero and infinity, with zero representing an equal distribution and higher values representing a higher level of inequality.

indicator_description_short: Average shortfall from a prosperity standard of $25/day
indicator_description_long: The average shortfall from a prosperity standard of $25 per day (adjusted for differences in purchasing power parity across countries). It is measured as the average factor by which incomes fall short of $25.

indicator_description_short: Multidimensional poverty, Monetary poverty (% of population deprived)
indicator_description_long: Multidimensional poverty, monetary poverty (% of population deprived) is the percentage of the population living on less than $2.15 a day at 2017 international prices. A household is deprived if income or expenditure, in 2017 purchasing power parity U.S. dollars, is less than US$2.15 per person per day. The indicator may differ from the one used for monitoring monetary poverty, if the multidimensional poverty measure comes from a different survey (or different version of the same survey).

indicator_description_short: Multidimensional poverty, Educational attainment (% of population deprived)
indicator_description_long: Multidimensional poverty, educational attainment (% of population deprived) is the percentage of population deprived of primary educational attainment. A household is deprived if no adult (grade 9 equivalent age or above) has completed primary education.

indicator_description_short: Multidimensional poverty, Educational enrollment (% of population deprived)
indicator_description_long: Multidimensional poverty, educational enrollment (% of population deprived) is the percentage of population deprived of school enrollment. A household is deprived if at least one child (grade 8 equivalent age or below) is not enrolled in school.

indicator_description_short: Multidimensional poverty, Electricity (% of population deprived)
indicator_description_long: Multidimensional poverty, electricity (% of population deprived) is the percentage of population deprived of electricity. A household is deprived if it does not have access to electricity.

indicator_description_short: Multidimensional poverty, Sanitation (% of population deprived)
indicator_description_long: Multidimensional poverty, sanitation (% of population deprived) is the percentage of population deprived of sanitation. A household is deprived if it does not have access to even a limited standard of sanitation.

indicator_description_short: Multidimensional poverty, Drinking water (% of population deprived)
indicator_description_long: Multidimensional poverty, drinking water (% of population deprived) is the percentage of population deprived of drinking water. A household is deprived if it does not have access to even a limited standard of drinking water.

indicator_description_short: Multidimensional poverty, Headcount ratio (% of population)
indicator_description_long: Multidimensional poverty, headcount ratio (% of population) is the share of people who are considered multidimensionally deprived. It is estimated on the basis of three dimensions: monetary, education, and basic infrastructure access; and an overall poverty cutoff of one-third of the weighted deprivations. Household is multidimensionally poor if it is deprived in more than a third of weighted deprivations.
